Description: Rim sherd with turn of body of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery lip-cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; top of lip glazed; exterior reserved with graffito inscription.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
There is no evidence of black figure-related incision on the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 708, no, 661, pl. 25.11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1353) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
